it.polimi.se2019.client.gui

Class MapController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.client.gui.MapController

  • public class MapController
extends java.lang.Object
    The MapController class contains all the elements of the map(ammo crates, weapon crates, players, and kill shot track). It provides methods to initialize the map's graphic elements' behaviour, methods to show the graphic elements, and methods to reset the graphic elements' style.
    Author:
    andreahuang

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapController

        public MapController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        The map initializer that is called wen the Map.fxml file is loaded. It adds the container of weaponcrates in one list for better easier processing.

      • setView

        public void setView(View view)
        The setView method is called by the main application to set itself and give access to the model for linking.
        Parameters:
        view - is the view that interacts with the server.

      • handleMapLoading

        public void handleMapLoading()
        The handleMapLoading method is used for the loading of a map. It initializes the clickable tiles based on the map's id, the ammocrate cards, and the players.

      • initTileGrid

        public void initTileGrid(Tile[][] tileMap,
                         int x,
                         int y)
        Adds a button to every tile of the map. There are two tile grids, one relative to the move, and the other to the shoot action. The differentiation is needed for the effects of the weapons.
        Parameters:
        tileMap - is the tile map.
        x - is the x coordinate of the tile.
        y - is the y coordintate of the tile.

      • setButtonTile

        public void setButtonTile(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane,
                          javafx.scene.control.Button button,
                          java.lang.Runnable handleAction)
        The setButtonTile method sets the behaviour of the mouse click event of each button from a tile. It provides a Runnable handleAction to support different kinds of input handling.
        Parameters:
        gridPane - is the grid pane that contains button.
        button - is the button which the mouse click event is set on.
        handleAction - is a runnable that builds the input for the mouse click event.

      • initAmmoGrid

        public void initAmmoGrid(Tile[][] tileMap,
                         int x,
                         int y)
        The initAmmoGrid is the first initialization of the ammo grid, which defines the effect of mouse click. for every single ammo card.
        Parameters:
        tileMap - is the tile map.
        x - is the x coordinate of the tile.
        y - is the y coordintate of the tile.

      • showAmmoGrid

        public void showAmmoGrid()
        The showAmmoGrid method show the ammocrate on the map. It links the model's ammocrates with its graphic counterpart.

      • initPlayerGrid

        public void initPlayerGrid(Tile[][] tileMap,
                           int x,
                           int y)
        The initPlayerGrid method is called to set the behaviours of each circle that represents a player.
        Parameters:
        tileMap - is the tile map of the model.
        x - is the x coordinate.
        y - is the y coordinate.

      • showWeaponCrates

        public void showWeaponCrates()
        The showWeaponCrates method shows the weapon crates on the map. It links the model's weapons with its graphic counterpart.

      • showKillShotTrack

        public void showKillShotTrack()
        The showKillShotTrack method shows the killShotTrack on the map. It links the model's killShotTrack with its graphic counterpart.

      • showPlayers

        public void showPlayers()
        The showPlayers method shows the players on the map. It links the model's players' position with its graphic counterpart.

      • handleTileSelected

        public void handleTileSelected(int id)
        The handleTileSelected method handles the selection of a button from the normal tile grid.
        Parameters:
        id - is the id/position in the list of tiles.

      • handleShootTileSelected

        public void handleShootTileSelected(int id)
        The handleShootTileSelected method handles the selection of a button from the shoot tile grid.
        Parameters:
        id - is the id/position in the list of tiles.

      • handlePlayerSelected

        public void handlePlayerSelected(java.lang.String color)
        The handlePlayerSelected method handles the selection of a button from player grid.
        Parameters:
        color - is the color of the selected player to be sent as input.

      • resetGrids

        public void resetGrids()
        The resetGrids method disables and resets all grids. It calls some helpers to disable different kinds of grid panes.

      • resetTileGridStyle

        public void resetTileGridStyle(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
        The resetTileGridStyle method resets the tile grid's buttons to the player's color.

      • resetAmmoGridStyle

        public void resetAmmoGridStyle()
        The resetAmmoGridStyle method resets the ammo grid's style.

      • resetPlayerGridStyle

        public void resetPlayerGridStyle()
        The resetPlayerGridStyle method resets the player grid's style.

      • resetWeaponCratesStyle

        public void resetWeaponCratesStyle()
        The resetWeaponCratesStyle resets the weapons grids' style.
